Detailed Description

template<class TIME_STAMP>
class TimeQueueT< TIME_STAMP >

This class implements a time queue, measured in game ticks.

The logic is basically stolen from Mercury, but it is intended to be used as a low resolution timer. Also, timestamps should be synchronised between servers.

Member Function Documentation

template<class TIME_STAMP>
TimerHandle TimeQueueT< TIME_STAMP >::add ( TimeStamp  startTime,
TimeStamp  interval,
TimerHandler *  pHandler,
void *  pUser 
)

Schedule an event.

If interval is zero, the event will happen once and will then be deleted. Otherwise, the event will be fired repeatedly.

Parameters:
startTime Time of the initial event, in game ticks
interval Number of game ticks between subsequent events
pHandler Object that is to receive the event
pUser User data to be passed with the event.
Returns:
A handle to the new event.

TIME_STAMP TimeQueueT< TIME_STAMP >::nextExp ( TimeStamp  now  )  const

Return the number of timestamps until the first node expires.

This will return 0 if size() == 0, so you must check this first

template<class TIME_STAMP>
int TimeQueueT< TIME_STAMP >::process ( TimeStamp  now  ) 

Process all events older than or equal to now.

All events with a timestamp earlier than the given one are processed.

Parameters:
now Process events earlier than or exactly on this.
Returns:
The number of timers that fired.
